content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an example of how you could implement this in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(word -> word[1] == uppercase(word[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the built-in `filter` function to iterate over each word in the provided list. The `filter` function applies a condition (`word -> word[1] == uppercase(word[1])`) to every element of the collection, and includes only those elements for which this condition is true.

In this case, the condition checks if the first character of the word (accessed by `word[1]`) is equal to its uppercase version (`uppercase(word[1])`). This will be true only for words that start with a capital letter.
